intro: Wahlenbergia lycopodioides, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a perennial herb native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often arranged in a cluster at the top of the stems. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. Wahlenbergia lycopodioides is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun and dry conditions.
